Reviews.Title: Best Samsung 60hz TV to date
Reviews.Author: Dangs "Dan"
Reviews.Content: I was ready to purchase the `12 model year Samsung 5000 series TV when I found out that this updated model was available. My local big box stores did not have the F5000 series in stock yet so I had to take a chance on this set and buy it sight unseen.I would rate myself as a fairly knowledgeable user, and a very picky one at that. I read AV forums online and I constantly tinker with my TVs to get the best picture possible out of them. I am very glad that I waited to get this new '13 model, as the quality and features are substantially improved.For starters, comparing this model side by side with the older Samsung EH5000 models, the first thing you will notice is how much thinner the F5000 is. At 1.9" thick, it's almost as thin as any LCD TV gets; and its roughly half as thick as the prior model. The 2" difference really matters, especially for those of you who will be wall mounting the TV. With a low profile mount, the TV is about as flat as one could expect to get.Appearance-wise, the F5000 is a stunning looking TV. The bezel is ultra-thin and glossy black. The bezel bows down slightly in the bottom center of the TV to show off the Samsung logo. Compared to another same size Samsung LCD in our house that is just three years older, the F5000 looks futuristic and sleek. I love the design direction that they have taken in 2013.But all this means nothing if the TV isn't just as fantastic from a performance standpoint. Luckily, the function is well matched to the form.The first thing I checked after getting my TV mounted to the wall was the evenness of the backlight. Our previous non-LED Samsung had a slight "flashlight" effect to it. When looking at an all black screen, you could see noticeable bright spots, especially near the corners. My F5000 set, however, appears to be perfectly even from edge to edge. Very impressive considering this is one of their lower end lines.The picture on the TV is excellent. I'm not sure how they achieved it, but considering its only a 60hz panel, the motion is the smoothest I have seen to date. No perceptible blur during fast action on the few shows I've watched so far. Like all other LED TVs, the factory settings have the backlight set too bright and the red level pushed too hard, which makes skin tones appear slightly too unnatural. This is a quick and easy fix in the video settings menu. I've only had the set a short while and am still making adjustments to my settings; I will update this review shortly with a full list of the optimum picture adjustments. But even without a single adjustment, I am just very shocked at how stunning the picture is. Also, I was expecting to immediately disable the "eco" features of the TV, but I surprisingly fell in love with one of them. It has a built in sensor that measures the brightness of your room, and adjusts the backlight accordingly. I had my mind set on disabling this right away, but after trying it out, it's actually very well implemented. It is especially useful for anyone using this TV in a bedroom... If you want to lay in bed and watch some TV in the dark, it will dim the picture slightly and keep it from being uncomfortably bright. If I wasn't using it in a bedroom, I'd probably want to disable it. Thankfully, its very easy to access the eco settings to adjust or disable it for those of you who don't care to try it.Right now, I can only think of two Cons to go against the many pros, and they are both minor. The first con is that the backlit remote is very very dimly lit. Even with the backlight activated, it takes a second or two to figure out what each button is. Thankfully though, this becomes a non-factor once you've used it a few times and have the locations memorized. The second con is that the included stand, at least on my 32", is very cheaply made. Samsung clearly has done some serious cost saving on the quality of the stand. Although they managed to make it look OK, the feel of it is terrible. It's a very thin gauge of reinforced plastic. This isn't an issue for anyone who is wall mounting like myself, but I felt it was worth mentioning. It feels significantly less sturdy than all previous Samsung TV stands that I have owned.One last thing I'll note for those looking to wall mount. Some descriptions list the 32" version as being VESA 400x400. This is INCORRECT. I can confirm for sure that it is VESA 200x200 for the UN32F5000. The Samsung manual will confirm this, but as of the time of me writing this review, Amazon lists it at 400x400 which is very wrong.Overall, the F5000 series feels like a big step in the right direction for Samsung, and I am thrilled with the TV so far. I will update this review in the near future with my recommended picture settings once I get them dialed in exactly as I want them.EDIT on 6/17/2013:As promised here are the best picture settings I have tried for this set. Courtesy of user Maverickaim9 from AVSforums:Updated Settings:Movie ModeBL 10Contrast 98Brightness 48Sharp 0Color 50Tint G52/R48Picture Size: Screen FitColor Space: NativeWhite Balance:25, 25, 21, 20, 25, 36Gamma -2Color Temp: Warm 2Everything else 0 or offMy set is a few months old at this point, still zero problems with it and we are absolutely loving it. I've been trying to respond to the comments posted. Let me know if you all need anything else clarified in my review.

Reviews.Title: Great general TV and PC monitor!! + How to fix blurriness as a PC monitor
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: First of all, this little TV is outstanding for its size and price!*Pros:- Plays at a full 1080p which looks quite clean and crisp for whatever you're using it for (not the best, of course, but nonetheless great IMO).- The frame itself looks sleek and elegant; no bulk whatsoever.- It's very lightweight, around 6 pounds or so, perfect for moving it from place to place (as a college student, this is great for moving it to and from my house and dorm).- I don't use the speakers that often, but it sounds pretty decent from my few experiences with it (although I am only about 5 feet away from it at most).*Cons:- The TV is aesthetically pleasing, in terms of the frame and picture, it feels somewhat cheap. The stand in particular is, I believe, pure plastic and seems very unstable sometimes. Not a deal breaker, but something I feel I need to point out.- The preset settings are somewhat dark and displeasing, IMO, so you might want to tweak the settings a bit.Now from a PC gaming standpoint, this is absolutely amazing!! As I said before, it looks great when playing any game, i.e Crysis 3, BF3, Fallout, etc. There is no lag or delayed reaction time on screen at all!One thing I would like to mention is setting-up this TV as a PC monitor. IF you are doing this PLEASE READ THIS TO PREVENT ANY FUTURE FRUSTRATION. You will notice that the screen will look VERY blurry when you first connect your PC to the TV ( In my experience, this was through  HDMI). There is a reason for this, which I won't go through in detail, but to fix this all you need to do is this:1.) Hit menu2.) Go to Source List3.) Hit right twice4.) Find the video connection you are using (Mine was HDMI, again)5.) Hit Tools6.) Hit name, then name it "PC"7.) Boom, done. Now you have an amazing PC Monitor!Anyways, overall this TV is versatile and looks stunning for its class. Definite recommendation to anyone looking for a small TV of monitor!

Reviews.Title: Great picture & bright screen. Has a transformer
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This review is for the 22" version.This tv is wall mounted in our kitchen, which is very well lit & surrounded by windows, yet the screen is bright and colorful. I have both a PS3 and AppleTv hooked up to it, and the picture rivals that of our much more expensive 3yr old 40" Sony Bravia (which was $1100), the colors don't have quite the depth of the Sony, but the clarity of this TV is better and moving images have more separation from the background image.Tv weighs very little and could easily be held by most any mount. Remote is nice and has a backlight.One complaint I do have is there is no mention of this unit being a lo-volt (12v DC) model. Meaning it requires an included transformer to step down the 120v AC power. This isn't a real problem unless you are wall mounting the tv and suddenly realize that you now have to contend with concealing a 1.5"x1"x3.5" transformer. I almost returned the tv based on this alone, however, the cord on the transformer was long enough that I could conceal the transformer in the cabinet below with my other A/V equipment and pull the wire up throughout the wall with the HDMI cable. This actually worked out to my advantage because the lo-volt wire is much smaller than a typical AC cord so it was easier to hide the wire from the back of the TV to the wall.On a side note, not sure if this TV (being lo-volt) would be a great choice for an RV/Motorhome.

Reviews.Title: see notes!  Good bedroom TV or gaming monitor
Reviews.Author: Miwo
Reviews.Content: Here are some various tidbits that are not really listed in the product description:- Bezel is GLOSSY, Screen is MATTE (very happy, I dont see reflections!)- Stand plastic and is not adjustable at all.  No vertical tilting, or even horizontal tilt.  Definitely the worst part about the TV- Game Mode turns off most image enhancement but cuts down on Input Lag.  I play fighting games that require 1-frame links (inputs within 1/60 of a second).  This TV is fast in game mode and should not hurt your gameplay- Sound quality is mediocre/average at best.  They are TV speakers, so you shouldn't expect much- An IR receiver sits blatantly on the bottom-right hand corner of the bezzle.  It is a small bump on the bottom of the screen.  Rather than put the IR receiver on the bezel or behind the screen, it makes the unit look cheap... so samsung can save a few bucks on each unit- Happy to report no overscan/underscan issues on PC/PS3.  i didnt have to make any adjustments to fill the screen correctly- No VGA input.  Only Two HDMI and One Component input.  Could be a problem if you want to connect a console, blu-ray, and a computer if you only have HDMI connections.  You would need a receiver or switcher obviously.- NON STANDARD POWER BRICK.  It is rated 14v @ 2.5a.  This means max power consumption should be 35W.  Energy star rating of $4 / year.  Could be a real hassle if the power brick decides to go.  Probably need to get a samsung brick, since 14V is not really common!!Hope this helps someone.  I bought this TV without knowing these things, but I am glad it worked out for me.  I use it as a console gaming monitor in my office next to my main PC

Reviews.Title: Not for Gaming, Specifically PS3, or Standard Def Cable
Reviews.Author: Zack
Reviews.Content: (note: this is a review of the 22")Good:  Colors. Black levels. Good calibration adjustments. Low latency for gaming.Bad:  This TV has a very bad (or none at all) internal scaler. This means any content that is not 1080p native will be a blurred  and pixelated mess (stretch out an image on your computer for an example). An input device with a decent scaler of it's own can compensate, but not every device has one, which is why it is imperative that any modern TV should include a quality scaler of it's own. I purchased this TV as an upgrade to my PS3 gaming TV, assuming that a TV in 2013 would have a decent scaler (PS3 game scaling is very, very poor). Unfortunately most PS3 games are 720p native, so will be blurred and pixelated. Needless to say, watching SDTV on this TV is especially bad as well. I mention this because I know a lot of people buy these small TVs to put in their kitchens or guest rooms, where there is only standard definition channels. You may be disappointed if you are in this category of buyers.Also there is no way to adjust the screen's position. It is locked in place on the stand. The viewing angles are decent though, so this isn't a huge issue.In short, My 6 year old TV handles 720p (and below) content much better than this one. 1080p native content looks fine, but with a TV this small, it won't look any better than 720p native content would on a 720p display. If you are in the market for a TV this size, you are better off going with a 720p display to avoid scaling issues. If you intend to use the TV simply for watching blu-rays and other 1080p native content, then this TV is a great buy. Otherwise avoid it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, bad reviews on this product countered
Reviews.Author: Ryan D
Reviews.Content: It may be the case that Samsung has made some changes in the stand, transformer, and internal scaler.  I've read bitter complaints about these issues.  I'll cover these below.  Note that I'm reviewing the 32" model.Picture:The picture is great.  I'll start by saying that I'm VERY picky when it comes to picture.  I spent 1200$ on an IPS panel type 2560x1600 monitor for my computer.  So, picture quality is extremely important, and I have a pretty good idea of what I'm talking about.-Out of the box, I felt no immediate need to adjust colors, they looked pretty good.  I might play with it later, but for the time being, default settings look good.-Other settings like contrast, brightness look just about right out of the box, no real need to adjust these either-Backlight - even with darker colors, I don't see any backlight bleed, or other common complaints about similar products.  Backlight is darn even.Appearance:-The appearance is excellent.  It has a very thin black glossy bezel (maybe 1/2"?).  In terms of the depth of the TV, it is less than 2".  So, there isn't much "bulk" to it.  You get pretty much just picture, without the bulk of many TVs.-No unsightly "sound bar" - really - who wants to see that?Stand:-I've seen complaints about the stand being "unstable" and "small".  Perhaps Samsung has changed the stand they ship it with, or perhaps these people forgot that you have to put in the screws included to make it stable.See the picture I uploaded here on the stand: http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo2ORC5UGBUX68Q/B00BCGRXD8/ref=cm_ciu_images_pl_link-You have to install 6 screws - an easy task - to assemble the stand and affix it to the TV.-The stand itself is about 1/2 of the width of the TV, and probably 8" deep.  So, it is a nice firm base on which the TV resides.  Unless you are playing rough with your TV, I see no reason for it to tip over.  Seems perfectly stable to meSound:-There is not a "sound bar" - which is a good thing.  Other TVs have huge unsightly or downright hideous soundbars at the bottom that nobody wants to see.  Sound is in the back of the TV.-Better than my old TV for sure.  I didn't have high expectations for this, but it is certainly not bad.  As far as built-in speakers go, it works just as well as any other.Tuner:I use this antenna: B007RH5GZI-Has a built-in ATSC and QAM tuner.-I only use the ATSC, but it works great.  I'm getting 20 channels over the air.  I had to run the scan twice to pick up a few additional channels, but I can live with that.  The tuner overall works great if you want free TV like me.Other issues:-The 32" model did not have a transformer built into the cord.  So, no unsightly "box" on your cable if you are using this model-There is a review titled "Not for Gaming, Specifically PS3, or Standard Def Cable" which complaints about the internal scaler.  As far as the 32" model goes, I have all kinds of quality coming in from my antenna. I have 480 (standard def), 720, and 1080.  The review states that the internal scaler makes things look awful and pixelated when using non-native resolutions (anything that is not 1080).  I haven't had this issue at all (and we have different models, so there could be an issue with the 22" maybe).  Standard definition looks better than my old TV (which was native low-def).  720 looks very very good, and of course 1080 looks downright awesome.  Note that if you are using a non-native input resolution (something not 1080), it of course won't look perfect.  You're forcing the TV to "blow up" the image, and there is error in this process.  it is not a simple pixel for pixel display as if you were using a native resolution.  So, it has to make some guesses as to what colors different pixels "should" be.-I turned off the "EcoSmart" option - which changes backlight brightness as a function of room brightness.  Seemed a bit too dim when the lights were on.  This isn't too much of an issue, easy to disable the option (as long as you know it is there!).That's all I have for now.  I give this TV three thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: Small in stature and big on performance!
Reviews.Author: Paul S. Remington
Reviews.Content: Following in the tradition of its larger cousins, the Samsung UN22F5000 is a 22"-class LED HD television that offers excellent video quality while holding back on connectivity options and extra features.  It isn't the smallest offering on the block.  That title goes to Samsung's 19"-class 19F4000.  The UN22F5000 is essentially the same television with one big exception: it offers 1080p with a video resolution of 1920 x 1080.  The 19" 4000-series television is only 720p.  If you're shopping for a small Samsung television and want to stay in the 1080p world, you'll want to take a good look at the 5000-series UN22F5000.While the UN22F5000 is in the 22" class, its effective size is actually 21.5" measured diagonally.  It comes with a nice selection of features, but it does not offer 3D imaging or Smart TV functionality.  It's a fairly basic set in terms of connectivity.  It comes equipped with two HDMI inputs, one USB 2.0 connection, one component video shared with one composite video, and one RF input used for terrestrial and cable television.  It comes with a DTV and analog tuner and is cable ready out of the box.  It contains no audio out or return channels.Its slimline form factor is sure to please consumers, although it does give it a lightweight feel some may say feels cheap.  A television's bulk and weight shouldn't be a sole factor in determining quality performance, and this is certainly true here.  The video performance from this television is excellent, regardless of its actual weight and size.  The thickness of the bezel is a slender .5" and its weight is a mere 5.7 lbs without the stand.  This is surprisingly light, especially for those used to larger 46" to 80" televisions.  Not to worry.  It may be svelte, but it is no wimp in terms of video performance for the money.In terms if features, this television carries the typical, basic features, which includes 60Hz performance with a clear motion rate of 120Hz, DTS premium sound and effects, and Dolby Digital Plus.  If this television has one drawback, it would be with its sound.  It comes with two 3W, downward firing, full-range speakers that are designed to do the job and nothing more.  It's common for television speakers to be limited in their performance and the smaller size of this television enhances this fact.  Regardless, most consumers are less interested in sound quality than they are video quality.  The UN22F5000 offers adequate audio performance, but don't look for wall shaking bass and deep low end.  It is rich in mid- and high-end frequencies, and these are emulated crisp and sharp.  The overall sound is thin, as would be expected from a driver size as is installed in this television.  The downward firing speaker position is ideal, especially for those who will wall mount the television.The UN22F5000 does a nice job of sipping power, which is why it has earned an Energy Star rating.  Power consumption is a modest 18W typical and 35W maximum.  Standby power consumption is under .3W.What's in the box?  Aside from the television, you get a stand, standard remote, battery for the remote, power cable, and user's manual.  The remote is very basic and has no learning features.  The television is VESA wall mount compatible, although the wall mount will have to be purchased separately.  A one-year parts and labor warranty comes standard for consumers.  For commercial users, this is reduced to ninety days.Overall, this is an excellent television for those looking for a smaller-sized set.  Its video quality is on par with larger televisions in Samsung's LED TV line.  It is void of many of the extra bells and whistles of higher-class televisions, such as 3D and Smart TV functionality, but it offers the most basic and important features most consumers are looking for.  Don't look for outstanding audio performance from its full range speakers.  It does offer satisfactory sound that is certainly presentable.  A separate home theater system will expand the audio performance, if sonic quality is important to you.For the price, it's hard to beat the Samsung UN22F5000.  While it's small in stature, it's also big on performance.

Reviews.Title: Solid performance and thin, clean design
Reviews.Author: Scott Francis
Reviews.Content: We wanted a small-ish bedroom TV that performs well and is reasonably thin.We looked at the current (2012) Samsung models, which review well but are nearly four inches thick, and Panasonic's, which are thin but get mediocre feedback. After some sleuthing (thanks, Value Electronics) I got ahold of Samsung's 2013 model numbers. I was attracted to this unit, dismissing the higher-end models due to their weird-looking stands and 3D and "Smart TV" features we won't use. I plugged this model into an Amazon search and was surprised to find it buried in the results. I was even more surprised to find it in stock.This model has a thin, clean design. The picture and sound are impressive. I'd probably lean towards a larger Panasonic or Samsung plasma for a main viewing area, but it's a great secondary TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Linda Bruck
Reviews.Content: Excellent, clear picture! So glad we waited for the 2013 model to come out it was certainly worth the wait!!

Reviews.Title: Top Quality Tv
Reviews.Author: B boy
Reviews.Content: This is a well-made set with a great picture. The only criticism I can make which I notice on all Samsung sets is that they must be adjusted for a natural looking picture. The default settings over-emphasize red and the colors are not quite as natural looking as on Sony tv sets. After Sony, Samsung makes the best tv sets.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Addition
Reviews.Author: MKS
Reviews.Content: We added this tv to our computer/guest room.  Someone trying to sell me a 720 said the difference in picture between the 720 and 1080 at this small a screen was not that noticable.  He was WRONG.  Great picture and (for a change) good sound.  The 10 watt speakers make a difference; not like a expensive sound system, but good sound for general use.

Reviews.Title: ~~~  Wonderful TV with a Low Price
Reviews.Author: Adam Smith
Reviews.Content: I got this TV to replace my 9-year old Toshiba CRT (a great TV) in my bedroom.Delivery was fast, all parts accounted for.Compared with Sony, the manuals are in very small print and a bit too brief.Had a little problem with assembly with the screws.  Be sure to take your time, use a medium-sized Phillips head screwdriver, and apply force.It's a beauty - no bezel wobble as a few have noted in earlier Comments.I affixed my old antenna to the rear of the TV.  I receive more channels than before, and none of them suffers from stutter / freezing up.Audio is good.  I won't need a soundbar.  I keep it simple per the KISS rule.Hookup of my Sony DVD player via HDMI cable (Amazon, of course) was easy.  My DVDs look and sound better on this TV than my Toshiba.When calibrating, the Menu structure takes time to be comfortable with.I've been tweaking the picture for the past 4 days.  (I use the settings in the "Dangs" long comment, and also from the CNet review of this TV.  The most critical option seems to be to start by selecting Mode = MOVIE.)It's a beautiful picture!  Watched my Packers win last night in Green Bay with enhanced enjoyment (and they beat Cleveland!).I watch a lot of French movies.  I've noted another plus of my new TV is subtitles appear so much better than they did on my Toshiba.Overall it's been fantastic so far with a few very minor negatives.Advice: if you still have an old, bulky CRT get this one!A solid 5-stars for Samsung and for Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Damn good gaming TV.
Reviews.Author: Jesse Anzelc "Jqwerty"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to game on and occasionally watch cable in my living room.  The size is good and I am very glad I didn't go any smaller than 50".  The style of the TV is very nice; the slim design is nice to have but wasn't as significant as I previously imagined.The 60Hz refresh rate is really all you need unless you are using 3D, which I don't care for (especially due to the bigger price tag).  The picture looks great and I haven't fiddled with settings too much.  I'm sure if I changed some settings I could get even better quality out of the set, but I'm satisfied thus far.  I always have the TV set to Game Mode to cut down on display lag and the TV performs very well in this area.  displaylag.com rates this TV as one of the best in terms of display lag, but I haven't had enough experience with TVs to notice one with slow response times.  So far I have thoroughly enjoyed gaming on this set.The TV also doesn't include any Smart TV features, but if you own any modern gaming consoles you can find the apps you want available there.  This makes the TV experience feel a little empty, but I don't feel like I'm missing out by not having a Smart TV.  I looked at Samsung's F5500 model (the same as this with the Smart features) and I liked the idea of the quad stand that comes with it, but the grey stand looked ugly in some reviews for that TV and I much prefer the square black stand.  I thought it would be cool to rout the wire for the Kinect under the quad stand rather than purchase a mount for on top of the TV, but I really couldn't handle the ugly grey stand (if it came with a higher quality one with a chrome appearance, I probably would have went that route because the F5500 also includes 3 HDMI ports instead of 2).One bummer about this set is that it only has 2 HDMI ports.  I have a cable box, 2 gaming consoles and more on the way, so I had to purchase an HDMI switch (I recommend the Kinivo brand).  Samsung makes you pay for the premium models if you want additional HDMI ports, but the Kinivo is a great solution to this problem.Of course some of the more expensive TVs would look nicer and have some other cool features, I think this set is pretty much ideal for anyone in my situation.  As long as you don't need over 50" screen size, more than 60 Hz refresh rate, 3D, more than 2 HDMI ports, Smart features, or the quad stand, this TV is perfect and a great value.  I spent a ton of time researching to make this purchase and I'm glad I ended up where I did.

Reviews.Title: Overall, pretty darn good!
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 2013 model to replace a large heavy old tube TV in the bedroom. I was convinced by the positive reviews and because I have a larger Samsung in the living room which I like a lot -- I am familiar with the Samsung setup and organization. My learning curve was next to nothing. The hardest problem was getting the darned stand attached to the darned TV! Trying to insert those tiny screws into their proper holes and getting them nice and tight was hard on my old bones and old eyes. What I like about the TV: ease of set up, works very well with OTA DVT stations and simple rabbit ears -- I am in a 30-35 mile range of stations; I can configure the sound -- the movie selection gives a nice surround sound, but you can also amplify it if hard to hear or want voice the most. I know some people thought sound was bad, but it is more than adequate in a smaller room with the variety of settings available. It works very well with my Toshiba laptop via HDMI for internet, streaming and playing DVDs. I liked the price which kept dropping and I got a refund from Amazon on the original price I ordered at. Saved about another $10. Excellent customer service, arrived in 2 days. In hindsight, maybe I would have preferred a bit larger screen, going toward 24-26 inch IF you could find such an animal. This 2013 TV does not feel as substantially built as the old big tube TV. I hope it lasts as long as the old one which is still going strong after all these years--just too heavy for a 70 year old to keep moving around.

Reviews.Title: It has stopped turning on
Reviews.Author: PK
Reviews.Content: We bought this model after reading the glowing reviews. The picture was excellent. But the TV began misbehaving when it was a month old - would turn itself off and on intermittently. Finally, it refused to turn on. Sumsung is sending a repairperson to examine it. We have other stuff from Samsung that has shown incredible reliability. This piece was a dud.

Reviews.Title: Samsung makes great TV's that are best in their class
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Cowen
Reviews.Content: Samsung makes great TV's that surpass every other manufacturer in their class. I have this TV as well as another Samsung in my house and I can tell you the image is beautiful. The only drawback with this TV its not a smart TV and you would need to use a WiFi router like Google TV or a Roku to get it to connect to the internet. This is why I gave this TV 4 stars instead of 5. But if this is not an issue for you then this TV is great.One thing that I have found with TV's that its very important to actually look at the TV in person. Now when you look at the TV's, go to a place like Walmart to see them, because many times specialty stores like Best Buy play with the lighting controls on the TV and in the store to skew the image to there advantage. Once you look at the TV simply look and decide which one looks better to you.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Garden Gnome
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Samsung TV and I am very happy with all of them.  They are well made and worth every penny you spend on them.  Excellent product, picture, sound and is a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Yes, it's a good one...
Reviews.Author: Jeff1949 "Jeff"
Reviews.Content: This is the first flat screen TV I've owned. After waiting for my old cathode ray TVs to die, I finally gave up and bought this one for the kitchen counter and mounted it on a swivel arm recommended to fit on the TV (also from Amazon). The swivel arm works great even though it took half the day to mount on the wall under the cabinets. But that's what I get for continually losing the little screws among the dirty dishes my wife ordered me to wash.I had to upgrade my DirecTV because the older system I had wouldn't let the new TV function well. The screen was very fuzzy with the old DirecTV system. The picture was far worse than the picture on the old TV had been. Fortunately, when I called DirecTV for some technical help, they accurately told me that it was the system being too old and not able to give the new TV what it needed. Sorry for the lack of impressive technical jargon here. My interests lie in other directions, like completing my "honey do" lists before my wife gets home. DirecTV installed an entirely new system--dish and HD converter box--for only $25 on a special, and they hooked up the new TV, too. They have specials all the time, so don't ever hesitate to call them. On rare occasions, life can be good.Now, the new TV's screen is a stunning display of crisp beautiful colors. I swear, I wasn't on drugs. It's been several weeks, and all is still good. So, if I had been on drugs, then I would have come down by now, and the TV would be a disappointment instead of impressive.The only thing I don't like about this TV--well two things, actually--is that wretched little ditty that the TV plays when you turn it on and off. It's something like what Windows plays on your computer when you turn it on and off. Unfortunately, unlike Windows, I haven't figure out how to mute the ditty on the TV.The other thing I don't like is that the earphone plug-in is on the side. There's no way to plug in a pair of earphones without turning the TV to the side and fumbling around to find that little hole to stick the plug in. That's a huge inconvenience, especially when I knock over the coffee pot. If I don't use earphones late on a Saturday night, I would be waking my wife up, and she'd be making my life more miserable than it already is. So, instead of risking the coffee pot, I turn on my computer, which doesn't play the little ditty anymore, and I cruise Youtube instead.In all, it's a great TV, especially if you enjoy Youtube.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother if you want a clear picture
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Not sure what is wrong with this tv but it has something to do with the refresh rate of the screen.  Picture looks good until someone or something moves fast.  The object blurs and stretches slightly making it a horrible picture.  The simple nodding of some ones head makes their forehead and hairline blur.  If you want quality HD picture, this is not the tv or monitor for you.  I'm returning.

Reviews.Title: Great for gaming and Blu Rays.
Reviews.Author: Cezar24
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an HDTV to use with the upcoming PS4 and had always heard that Samsung offered great picture quality.  After receiving the Samsung 22" I tested it out with my PS3 and Xbox 360.  The image did not look that great until I applied the settings posted in another review.  After the change, it was amazing.  Great colors and a crystal clear image.  I was also impressed with the sound.  For being such a thin and lightweight display, I was expecting that tin can sound from the speakers.  Instead I was greeted with pretty good sound.  I am very happy with my purchase and am looking forward to hooking it up to my PS4 when it launches.

Reviews.Title: good until the unit started flickering.
Reviews.Author: charles
Reviews.Content: we needed a smaller tv for the bedroom and this fit the bill-- it replaced an older Samsung and we were struck by how much it looks like a computer monitor.  The power button (if you're interested) is on the back of the unit and is almost the exact same as the little knobby joystick on an XBOX controller.  despite all this, we were happy to have the tv (takes up minimal space, good sound and color) until the unit started flickering on and off a month after we got it.  just recently it stopped turning on altogether and the red light on the front, when the tv is powered on, using either the remote or the unit itself, just flickers and the screen flashes on for a second at a time like something out of a horror movie.we're sending it back.

Reviews.Title: Great television
Reviews.Author: John Mix
Reviews.Content: The television came just as advertised.  Wonderful picture and sound.  Also very energy efficient.  The earlier models were less expensive but with a long term purchase like this I decided to spend the extra.

Reviews.Title: 22" TV Exceeds Expectations
Reviews.Author: Cobber "A Cobber"
Reviews.Content: Good price for a small quality TV.  Still new and used in bedroom about 2x/week.  Sound is better than expected.  HDMI port is useful.  Picture seems quite clear with both SD and HD.

Reviews.Title: Wow! fantastic panel.
Reviews.Author: icose
Reviews.Content: This panel has an excellent picture and plenty of image adjustments. I used the settings posted by other reviewers and they work great. The factory settings of "Standard" is a tad too sharp for my taste, while the "Movie" settings a tad too dull. The posted settings are just inbetween - great!Although it has only 2 HDMI ports, I found that the component video connection works great and provides quality indistinguishable to HDMI. So this makes 3 ports, which is good enough for most use.The remote is small and functional, but not impressive. The backlighting is weak and all the buttons look similar. It doesn't really matter since I use the Verizon set-top box remote for most everyday use.The audio quality is also very good, with plenty of options to tweak it - I used the one that emphasizes voices and like it a lot.I was a little bit wary to go for the 50 inch panel since most reviews are for the 22 inch panel. I do not regret my purchase. This is 2013 technology! The panel is so light I can easily carry it myself. It is also super-thin ! For the moment I have it on the stand and the whole thing looks great. The panel design is "understated modern", with thin black edges. I will later mount it to the wall.The price point is really excellent (paid $799). And I love that I'm not paying for useless 3D or Smart technology. All I want is a great quality, simple TV without all the unnecessary features that bloat most other panels. Adding internet connectivity is trivial through an Apple TV or Bluray player, so why pay for it in the TV?

Reviews.Title: Perfect in RV
Reviews.Author: Dane Gardner
Reviews.Content: I'll be boondocking for two months this summer, and I really needed 12V tolerant TV that didn't cost and arm and a leg.  RV specific TVs can cost more than they are worth, and don't have a lot of the nicer features.  After doing a lot of research, I found that this TV uses a 14V converter, which is near the charging voltages for automotive battery systems.  I was a little nervous that it wouldn't operate at lower voltages, as the batteries discharged, but I bet on it being able to handle it.  It paid off --I've had no problems with the unit down to 11V.  It draws very little power, and with my dual battery setup, it can last several days of constant viewing (if I don't use anything else).  And, I can use a large capacity USB thumb drive for playing video files, which none of the RV-specific TVs can do.  It's perfect!Edit: I should add that, instead of cannibalizing the supplied power cord, I made my own using an EIAJ-5 connector (Digikey part #: CP-026-ND).  This allows me to use shore power whenever I have access.Edit: I tested using an independent power supply recently to see just how low it would go before shutting off.  9.9V is about the minimum, which is lower than you should be letting your deep cycle batteries get.  Also, it draws between 1.9A and 2.2A using broadcast TV, and averaged 2.2A (2.5A peak) playing a 1080p H.264 video on a thumb drive.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality + Pic but Make sure You Have All Accessories
Reviews.Author: A fan
Reviews.Content: Picture is phenomenal. Sound is great. Easy to set up stand and navigate.  And delivery service fantastic. Wen I took it out of box, I initially threw away one piece to mount to stand and then had to go digging through by trash later, so be thorough in opening contents and pulling out of packaging.I hadn't read description & reviews completely enough to understand this is not a smart TV. I had anticipated a device I could stream wireless through or use a dongle or similar device. While not that simple, set-up is easy and intuitive to get Internet, Netflix, etc. A USB of downloaded programs can be put in or I went to the store and bought a Roku box for $ 40 which easily plugs into TV and gives you access to Netflix, Hulu, Pandora, Target Ticket, Blockbuster, HBO, and other media streaming from Internet.If you want local TV on this, may have to buy an antennae. I had to. They got me to try a sleek, smooth flat device at store. But turns out the old rabbit ears worked best. (Or you could try saving your money and using a wire coat hanger. :) )

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous Picture and Sound...But No Netflix
Reviews.Author: Robert Martin
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a Proscan DVD/LCD combo.  The picture and sound on this model are gorgeous and well-suited for a kitchen environment which is noisy and demands a good picture at off-angles.  My only frustration is that Samsung does not offer any "Smart TV" features in this size screen.  So no Netflix in the kitchen.  I'm surprised that none of the manufacturers seem to offer smart features in these kitchen sized TVs.  Lots of people want to stream while they're in the kitchen!

Reviews.Title: Good Quality, Light Weight HDTV
Reviews.Author: T. H. Stauffer
Reviews.Content: We installed this HDTV in our camper.  It's light weight and picture quality made it ideal for this application.  This unit does come with a 110 volt to 12 volt converter, which must be used for use with regular household current.  The 12 volt does give us the option of running the TV off of the 12 volt RV system and battery, though we have not found need for this yet.

Reviews.Title: Bought it for baseball playoffs, exceeded my expectations.
Reviews.Author: J. Keck "upachee"
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv in a hurry for the baseball playoffs. Didn't really do my homework but saw a good deal on here and pulled the trigger. I mounted the tv in the corner of my covered deck and used an hdmi cable to hook my macbook up to it to stream the game. I have to say i'm thoroughly impressed with this tv. Haven't even seen the menu screen yet. Just plugged it in, hooked up the macbook, and selected the hdmi source. Picture was great, sound was really impressive considering there are no visible speakers on the front. I have a 21 year old loud a/c unit (i bought a foreclosure and haven't updated the unit yet) and this little tv was loud enough to hear clearly over the a/c unit. I'm sure it helps that i have it mounted in a corner so the sound bounces off the 2x10's that it's mounted to. I used the videosecu articulating arm mount (which is ok) and the tv looks great. Mount works well with the tv. I haven't tried the antennae input or anything else on the tv really except macbook (2011) to tv via hdmi (a 50' hdmi cable that i bought on amazon for cheap mind you). I usually don't write reviews but this tv needed one. Great buy in my opinion. I'm fairly picky but have been happy as a peach grilling shrimp this evening watching the braves on this tv. One thing worth mentioning, I grill on the uncovered portion of my deck which is probably 15' or so away from where the tv is mounted and I can see what is going on just fine. Can't always tell how many balls/strikes there are but I can definitely stay in touch with the game while tending to the grill. Great tv!

Reviews.Title: Good alternate Monitor
Reviews.Author: Sanjiv
Reviews.Content: I primarily purchased this HDTV to function as a PC Monitor. Why didn't I purchase a PC HD Monitor in the same price range? Because the TV provided more input port options and by default has good sound output, if you're connecting via HDMI.

Reviews.Title: Right Size, Easy Installation, Good picture
Reviews.Author: J. McGreevy
Reviews.Content: Only had the TV for about 3 weeks but overall it's working well.  Ease of installation and picture quality are very good.  Slim and light weight as well.

Reviews.Title: Nice but doesn't last
Reviews.Author: Nancy J
Reviews.Content: 6 months after purchasing this television, it started shutting itself on and off without touching anything. Electric short in the system. I was very disappointed that is failed after only 6 months.

Reviews.Title: Great for gaming
Reviews.Author: Collin Bentley
Reviews.Content: I'd been using an old SDTV to play Xbox 360 on for several years now, and I was a bit reluctant to switch to HD because of the input lag I've seen from some HDTVs. With the next-generation consoles (Xbox One, Playstation 4) coming out later this year only using HDMI cables, I had to make the switch. As someone who plays a lot of first-person shooters and fighting games, lag could drastically affect my gameplay. When I hooked this tv up and got an HDMI cable for my 360, I could hardly feel any lag, even when not in game mode, and having game mode on makes it even faster. I am very pleased with this tv and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to get an HDTV to play video games on.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value and great performance
Reviews.Author: Keitho 51 "Captain Video"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this flat screen to compliment our kitchen after our post-Sandy rebuild.  It looks terrific and has a lot of useful features.  I do not sit and stare at the screen and pick apart every little detail:  I've been a television engineer for 40 years and I, for one, want to be entertained when I come home.  This Samsung fills the bill.

Reviews.Title: As Good as expected.
Reviews.Author: Johnny
Reviews.Content: The TV is quality made as expected coming from Samsung. I am always happy with Samsung Products. Picture quality is good but not quite as nice as my larger Samsung Television. Sound is very nice. I do wish that there was a tilt adjustment on the base.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Picture and Sound
Reviews.Author: suncitysandy
Reviews.Content: I ordered this sight unseen as no retail store in my area had it in stock.  The review of the previous model EH465000 is the same for this model.  It is upgraded as it is much thinner than the previous 2012 model.  This model is 2013.  I ordered it 5/24 and it was delivered 5/29 much quicker than original date of 5/31-6/3.  Good for Amazon!  Because of the 1/2 inch bezel around the frame, the picture seems much bigger.  It is very bright and the sound is very, very good!  This tv is on a cox dvr box, but I am able to adjust color, contrast and picture with the regular remote.I hope it lasts longer than the previous 32 inch Panasonic I purchased last December.  That TV went out in 4 months by shutting down.  Panasonic does not send technician to home unless TV is over 32 inch.  Because I am disabled and was recently hospitalized they were very nice in sending a tech to the house.  There are only 2 things to replace on that set and he replaced both.  4 days later, we heard a booming static sound, no voices, nothing but static.  Called back the tech and he said he never heard that before.  Panasonic offered a newer model of same set or money back.  I took the money.  I then decided that I would purchase the 46 inch set because that size they do send tech to home.  Glad I did.By the way, I don't know if it was for 22 inch model or 46 inch model, but the stand is VERY sturdy, and does not wobble.  It is a large stand, much larger than my previous 40 inch set.  I would say, if you want a good picture,sound get this TV!

Reviews.Title: Fantasic TV
Reviews.Author: Manolo
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV the picture and sound quality are fantastic. Its great for gaming. If you wanna know since it doesnt say it has 2 HDMI ports. I also got it for $177 last week. Too bad the price sas raised :( But not by that much, i think itll be worth it

Reviews.Title: The Included Stand Comes with Three Mounting Screws.  DO NOT THROW THESE OUT
Reviews.Author: James Ahn
Reviews.Content: I almost made this mistake, just putting the TV on its square stand and boy was it wobbly.  I went on eBay to look for replacement stands, then saw the factory stand on sale with a picture - wrapped in the shrink wrap was a small plastic bag with three screws in it.  WHAT?  So I ran back outside, grabbed the box, and sure enough in the wrapping I tossed there was that little bag!  Took the three screws out, screwed the stand into the TV base, and bingo goodbye wobble!

Reviews.Title: Will work on 12VDC. Great camper TV.
Reviews.Author: Thomas C.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because of people mentioning the transformer. I made a cigarette lighter DC adapter and it works in my camper now without A/C. Excellent quality and the media browser works well when playing video off a hard drive plugged into the USB port.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture for the Price
Reviews.Author: Sarkis Aktavoukian
Reviews.Content: Great little TV, no complaints.My biggest concern was that the 60Hz would look choppy, which I've observed on larger TVs, but everything's smooth on this one.I'm glad I ran across this TV, during Black Friday, while looking at another Samsung, which was a few inches bigger, bit more expensive, and lower specs.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: summer
Reviews.Content: Got it as a birthday gift for by significant other. He liked it alot and its being six months and he hasn't had any problems with it. This is the first tv I've bought online. It came in four days and the price was great.

Reviews.Title: Nice, but won't work with standard wall mount.
Reviews.Author: TheBigShot
Reviews.Content: Nice TV for kids room. Good picture, very thin. Unfortunately, would not work with the standard TV mount I bought.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: pam ray
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased to replace another TV of similar size, but less quality than a Samsung.  Notable difference in quality with excellent picture and sound.  Great price compared to retail stores.  Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: IT'S SAMSUNG . . . WHAT ELSE WOULD YOU EXPECT?
Reviews.Author: Sandee Woods
Reviews.Content: This TV is in my kitchen.  It is the perfect size, and has a picture so clear that sometimes I just want to sit at my kitchen table and watch my favorite programs there.  I have Samsung in my bedroom, so I'm not surprised at how beautiful the picture and sound is.  Bottomline:  It's Samsung . . . what else would you expect?  I would definitely recommend this TV to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom TV, console and laptop monitor..
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: Excellent HD picture quality. I used it in my bedroom. I also use it with my laptop and PS3/Xbox 360. Very little difference from an actual HD monitor. The 2 HDMI port make it easy to switch from STB cable to laptop/console display via remote. For the price you can't beat it. Samsung makes high quality HDTV's period! I highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: counter top TV
Reviews.Author: Larry James
Reviews.Content: for a small tv this one has a fantastic picture. The only problem with it is the sound is not that great. other than that I would highly recomend it

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Shoaib Ali
Reviews.Content: specifically got it for ps3 and works perfect, great picture if you have and hdmi cable for gaming, av cables work fine too for ps3 but hdmi makes an amazing difference

Reviews.Title: Cheap price reflects cheap picture quality - stay away.
Reviews.Author: Lologuy "cracked PDA"
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed by color clarity and brightness(I waited a while to write this review to give the unit some break in time). No matter how I try to adjust the settings, can never get the correct contrast, color, brightness combination. Pictures either look washed out, bleached out, or too dim. I have a 60" Samsung which is absolutely gorgeous so I was expecting similar picture quality but this unit is nowhere close. It's only redeeming value is the price but even that Isn't enough to overcome its poor picture qualify. Lucky it's in the bedroom where it's only used to catch the news prior to going to sleep. This HDTV just don't cut it for extended viewing.

Reviews.Title: Great size for a kitchen TV
Reviews.Author: Jackie A.
Reviews.Content: I needed to update from an older model 19 inch TV for my kitchen. I started looking at newer 19 inch TV's, and realized my older TV had a larger frame around the screen. So I thought I could easily buy a larger screen with less frame. That is exactly what this Samsung has, a very small frame, it's all screen. My older TV also could not get HD, so the picture was smaller than the screen size. This  HD Samsung has a great clear picture. I needed to adjust the sound, the factory setting sounded tinny, but with a few adjustments the sound is good. (I think I am spoiled by surround sound on the family room TV) I also have not watched any movies on this Samsung, mostly news and talk shows, so the sound isn't as important to me.I read all the reviews on Amazon before I make any purchase, and this TV has not disappointed. If you need a small TV, in my case for the kitchen, at a reasonable price, this TV is a good buy. My son, who does my hook-ups, was impressed with the picture, and the easy set up. I would recommend this Samsung to anyone looking for a great TV at a great price.

Reviews.Title: TRANSFORMER???
Reviews.Author: Deadmau5e
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have never seen a TV with a transformer on the plug. All TV's use dc voltage, but the transformer is incorporated inside the unit itself. Not this state of the art, late model 22" television. I bought it to mount low profile on our bathroom wall and was completely shocked when I took it out of the box to find a huge transformer that is thicker in depth than the TV itself! How irritating. No where in the description does it specify this. Only a few reviews like mine, but who has time to read through several hundred reviews?Trying to decide whether to return it or not. Maybe I can stuff the transformer in the wall. Stupid Samsung engineers!Forgot to mention the typical dc plug literally sticks 'straight' out of the back of the tv adding another 1.5" (yes I measured) to the overall depth. I'll never buy another Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: TV cannot be flush wall mounted!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Wexler
Reviews.Content: This TV cannot be mounted close to the wall because it has a d/c adapter with a chord that projects out over 2" from the back of the TV. Of course, this is only an issue if you want to wall mount (and are using a mounting plate that does not position the back of the TV over 2" from the wall). Also, this is the first TV that I purchased that has a dc adapter, which requires (includes) an adapter box to plug into the electrical outlet; I don't understand why this would be preferred over having this function built into the TV. So for my purposes, the TV is not usable.

Reviews.Title: Over a year later, still an awesome TV
Reviews.Author: NyReckDiver
Reviews.Content: Even after a year, this TV is still a great deal as a general purpose or small room TV.  In fact, it is an even better deal now that it is much lower in price.  However, it still has a minor problem in that scaling is horrible with non native 1080p content that is scaled across the screen, resulting in pixelation.  The only solution is to not scale the content, resulting in a smaller image.  Another deal breaker for some, especially if wall mounting, is that the power source of this televsion includes a transformer on the power cord.The television is packaged well with very good instructions and everything you need to get going.  The build quality is better than "no name brands" in the same range.  However, most of these televions have little differences in build quality these days (in same range)- it is the design you have to look at.  In this case, I love the design of the F5000. It has a slim glossy bevel design with a flat matte screen, which is critical if using in a room in which an amnbient light source will be pointed at the screen (think full sunlit window). I found the stand a little wobbly, though not really unstable.  The F5000 is a very thin TV at about 1.8" in depth.  Samsung includes a solid backlit remote, which is very nice to have (wish cable companies would use these).Usability is very good though I did experience a very minor backlit issue where, on a pure black screen, I noticed some minor bright spots.  Absolutely no impact on picture quality unless you watch a pure black screen all day. Picture quality is simply fantastic.  Clarity is amazing and the 60hz refresh rate does not impact performance.  Even in fast moving scenes, I experienced no blur or image artifacting. I recommend you reduce the factory pre-set brightness right out of the box.  Also, allow the TV a week or so to break in (sounds weird, but true).  Sound was acceptable for a small room.  However, in larger rooms, especially with vaulted ceilings abd hardwood floors, a supplemental sound bar is required.  For a bedroom or even mid-sized room, without vaulted ceilings and a hardwood floor, sound is fine.  Though not a "true dedicated gamer," we tested gaming capability with an Xbox360 and a couple of fast moving graphic intensive games. We experienced absolutely no lag.Overall, this TV is a hit given the right application.  The scaling issue is not a real deal breaker and even if wall mounting, the transformer can be acocmodated (in many cases). When you compare these minor issues, against the current price, I still have to rate the TV at 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV at a great price. We replaced a huge, and older, tube set in our bedroom and can now appreciate the outdoors via our windows. The sound is great, which I was concerned about. The display is terrific! We are thinking about getting another for our exercise room, in front of the treadmill ;).

Reviews.Title: A good size tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Eileen H.
Reviews.Content: I am using this as a computer monitor and have to say it is very nice. I have connected an antenna and the tv picture is also good. I figured why not spend a little more money and get a tv instead of just a computer monitor. I was easily able to price match when Amazon dropped the price a week or so later. Overall a good picture for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great as long as action being watching isn't fast
Reviews.Author: Kent A. Compton
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for two days and so far, so good. It's really light which made mounting it on an articulating wall mount a snap.  The HD quality is great with regular television but this is not a good TV if you're going to watch sports.  The fast action in this weekend's NCAA basketball games pixelates the video with xfinity's set top box set to match the TV--1080p.

Reviews.Title: A fine replacement for my old kitchen SONY
Reviews.Author: mavn "Rand Fan"
Reviews.Content: I already have a 51" Samsung Plasma Smart HDTV for my Great Room, so my Samsung experience is very good.So what's not to like: a very watchable 22' HDTV picture, a small footprint and a very reasonable price.  Out of the box, the audio quality is "tinny".  But the sound quality can be adjusted and you will be rewarded in these efforts with reasonable, if not room-filling, sound.  So, yes, a fine TV for our kitchen.  Note that the included stand must be screwed onto the TV unless you are wall-mounting, but that stand set-up is a very simple 2 minute job (screws included). 5-stars are generally reserved, for me, for near-perfection, so this gets 4.

Reviews.Title: Decent, not ideal
Reviews.Author: Nomenclature
Reviews.Content: Very thin sound, as others may have mentioned. What I find slightly disturbing is the limited viewing angle: from below, or the sides, the screen image nearly disappears. Straight on, and close in, the image is fine.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture but slow response time to remotes
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really like the picture and recommend this TV for its purpose.  It does have a slow reaction time to remote controls, its own and Verizon's universal as well.  My father loved it for Christmas and it was easy to set up.Its worth the money I spent on it.

Reviews.Title: Works exactly as advertised
Reviews.Author: William Styczinski
Reviews.Content: Great little TV here. Two HDMI ports, a coax port for cable and a plugin for computer speakers.This is a little hard to describe in words, but my favorite part is the component hookup. Component, if you don't know, is the type that has your green, blue, and red plugins for video, then the white and red for audio, whereas composite is just the yellow for video, then the white and red for audio. So, there's the component hookups in the back, but the green component port is actually half-green, half-yellow, allowing a yellow composite cable to plug in to that port just fine. So, this little TV can support the old DVD players and game systems and everything.Apart from that, crystal clear display. Fits perfectly in the entertainment center we bought it for, and I plug my computer into it to watch movies all the time.

Reviews.Title: Decent 22 inch
Reviews.Author: Enrico W.
Reviews.Content: Overall, the TV is fine. However, here are some drawbacks that, if known, may have adjusted my decision on purchasing.  They are as follows:-without significant adjustment, the picture is dark. Specifically, it's dark in standard mode. It's also horrible when viewing at a lower vertical angle.  I've seen many reviews to the contrary. Therefore, I thought something was wrong with my unit. However, when checking an identical display version in a store, I seen the same problem. I am beginning to believe that this is an issue only on the 22 inch version as I cannot seem to find an issue like this on larger screens. Ultimately, I don't expect this to be an issue for me once I mount the TV on a tiltable mount.  But, be aware, especially if not using an adjustable mount.-The plastic stand is cheap and not adjustable. This is consistent with other reviews.-Be aware that there are only two HDMI inputs. (Cable box, Blu-Ray player... Nothing else)

Reviews.Title: Thin, light, good price, good picture, with some annoying physical limitations.
Reviews.Author: Tony Ruth
Reviews.Content: Just got this last week, so only some first impressions here. I should mention that I'm not a monitor buff, we're pretty basic in what we need, but I wanted something thin and lightweight that would take up less space in the room than the 2007 Aquos we had. The picture and sound quality on the TV is fine, seems to be at least as good as the Aquos, and it's much much lighter and easier to hang without worrying that it's going to fall of the wall and crush my kids. There are two annoyances I've had so far:1 - While the TV is extremely thin, you will have to mount it 1.5" away from the wall if you're using more than one HDMI port or component cables (we still have a DVD player -- again, we may be unusual). But the fact that only one HDMI port faces sideways essentially means that you lose a lot of the nice flatness against the wall that you should get from a thin TV; we had to go find spacers for the wall mount and you can see more of the assembly back there than I'd like. This is minor, but I think it's one of the reasons people buy a skinny TV, so it seems annoying.2 - No physical buttons at all. I know this is getting more and more standard, but it's annoying not to have at least power and input buttons on the top, side or back of the frame. We have multiple generations in our house and I may be the only one who actually knows how to run the universal remote, so everyone just wants a power button. Also, strangely, this TV takes about 5 seconds to find the input every time you turn it on, and in the meantime a window pops up saying "connection lost" -- also confusing to my household.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I have been without at TV for about two years. Wanted one basically to keep on current events.This TV was easy to set up, attach to an antenna, and sit back and enjoy.The image quality is exceptional. What the stations portrayed, well that another essay. I love this TV. It's images are so clear and true. And the off button accessible as well.

Reviews.Title: A Very Good Product For the Price
Reviews.Author: L. Desser
Reviews.Content: The TV set was easy to install and get running.  The picture is good.and the sound is acceptable.  It is energy efficient and very lightweight.

Reviews.Title: The picture is great!!
Reviews.Author: Lee Shamblee
Reviews.Content: Arrived in two days with free shipping.  Awesome!  The picture is great but if you need the volume high you will need separate speakers as the speakers are in the back on this model.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV! LONG PROCESS OF SHIPPING.
Reviews.Author: Corinne Finks
Reviews.Content: The tv itself is awesome! Exactly what i wanted for a good price. However, don't use prime because it will still take weeks for you to get it. Wasn't happy with them saying it was already at my house when it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: GREAT SMALL TV
Reviews.Author: Marinie
Reviews.Content: .  I bought this TV to be able to mover around the house when I signed up with AT&T; Uverse.  The TV is easy to move, has a great picture and set up was easy.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, No buttons?
Reviews.Author: Xanthene
Reviews.Content: Great picture.  Used as a monitor via HDMI at 1080p, a PS3 through the 2nd HDMI, and have a Component wire for my cable box.  The picture out shines the 24inch viewsonic it replaced.My only complaint is the Off button... or lack there of.  Instead of buttons, the TV used a 4 directional knob. Reviews.Title: 22-Inch Samsung? Buy 32-inch.
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: I bought both, a 22-inch Samsung (UN22F5000) and 40-inch Samsung (UN40F5000) LED televisions.Of all the models of the UN{size_in_inches}F5000 model of televisions, the 22-inch one only puts out three watts audio, and the 22-inch is much like a small computer monitor, making the 22-inch only sensible for small dormitory use.  However I have this 22-inch mounted on the wall within a small kitchen, and the sound and video size is just barely adequate.  Moving to a 32-inch for a small kitchen would have likely made reading the on screen menu text much easier.The other models provide 10 watts audio, including an ECO mode for automatically adjusting the backlight according to room brightness.PROS:1) Very light compared to old televisions.2) Easy to wall mount.3) Except for the 22-inch, the televisions have S/PDIF Toslink output.4) Very good picture compared to other televisions, and according to other's reviews and being a popular buying choice.5) Has plenty of features needed by most users, reserving additional features for the more expensive models.  (ie. SmartTV)6) Remote control is always dimly lit whenever buttons are pushed.  (I really wish my Yamaha receiver had lit buttons!)CONS:1) I'm thinking, the remote control has some poorly located buttons or keys.  For example, the mute key is commonly located below or above the volume keys.  Other commonly used keys are located away from the center of the remote control key pad, such as the "P Size" key for adjusting the video stream's size to fit the monitor.2) The on screen info text describing the video stream's title and video header information doesn't remain on screen while changing channels.  Most times when people are changing channels, they're wanting to know what is currently on TV and are likely wanting to read the title and about information.  After changing channels, people need to continuously press the Info key to see this information.  Also, only "what's on next" is displayed within the channel information.  Most channel changing boxes allow this buy selecting the TV Guide button, and using the left and right keys for changing the channel while displaying the Channel information.  Not really intuitive, but I think I figured how to find this extended guide by clicking the "Channel List" key and using the right cursor key twice for a selected channel.  The guide does then detail a 12 hour TV guide, the time span available is applicable to your local broadcasting area.3) The remote control doesn't have a stylish inverted dome for the up, down, left, right and select keys; which would allow easier menu settings navigation.  I constantly find myself getting lost within the menu settings because I'm usually pressing the wrong navigation key!  (ie. Unique key shapes can aide with memorizing the key functions of the remote or using concave shapes for up, down, left, and right keys.)4) Monitor's on and off button is located behind the monitor, and not well known or visible to most initially using the TV.  (Users may initially believe they can turn-off the monitor using only a remote.)5) Even at 10 watts speaker output, the speakers are still just barely audible at 90-100% volume level.  One of the likely reasons, the speakers are embedded and facing down towards the floor, and further away from the viewer if the display is tilted.  Since most have a stereo system and are piping the audio through either HDMI or S/PDIF Toslink, this is likely not much of an issue, but this model does not have S/PDIF or HDMI output and only has two channel PCM RCA jacks.  However within the software menu settings, there is an amplify option under the sound settings.  The amplification seems adequate for the kitchen now!6) Channels are slow to change after pressing buttons.  Also just after power-on, the unit doesn't accept any key presses for five seconds or more.7) Turning the TV on, takes 3-5 seconds and considered very slow.  Matter of fact, the TV is just slow to respond when initiating most functions with the remote control.  (ie. Switching inputs between TV Tuner and other HDMI inputs is aggravatingly slow.)8) The auto on/off or programmed timers is quickly implemented.  The TV will not power-on when using another input other then TV when last turned-off.  (ie. The TV will not auto turn-on if the TV was last using a HDMI input versus TV tuner.)9) The programmed timers conflict, if the off-time is 6:00PM and another timer is using a 6:00PM on-time.  As such, users need to have the TV turn-off one minute prior to the start of a another timer setting.  (ie. The TV must be off in order for a timer to be activated.  The TV will not simply tune while on to a new channel designated by a new timer.)10) The mute key puts a static mute icon on the TV screen, and then goes to an intermittent scrolling flashing mute icon!  For those having their large screen TV's attached to their home stereo systems (which will likely be the majority with larger screen models), this is quite irritating!  I find it's more desirable to simply turn the volume down, however more tedious as this operation should be a one button push.Although a few hiccups, still a very good product.

Reviews.Content: I appreciate good technology but, as a Baby-Boomer, was born a generation too early to grow up in the computer-age and therefore tend to fall into the camp of those best described as "technologically challenged." I was in the market for an external monitor to add to a recently purchased MacBook Pro (another delightful walk on the wild side for me). I was primarily interested in a monitor that would give good resolution and an enjoyable movie-viewing experience from DVDs and Netflix streaming. Also, the monitor needed to be simple to connect---completely hassle-free, with no experience or technological know-how necessary. This Samsung HDTV was recommended by a friend, so I gave it a try.This product delivered! I love the high-resolution picture it provides, and connecting it to my lap-tap could not have been simpler. It merely involved connecting an adapter to the Thunderbolt Port on my MacBook Pro,  and an HDMI cable to the adapter and the HDMI IN 2 (DVI) on the back of the Samsung HDTV. Simple connection. Fabulous picture! Highly recommended!NOTE: Just be sure to order an adapter and HDMI cable with your purchase; they are not included with the Samsung HDTV. (I ordered the Amazon Basics High-Speed HDMI cable and the Kanex iAdapt HDMI  Adapter; both available on amazon.com.)
